main event: Multiple witnesses, including civilians and airmen, observed an unidentified aerial object with a bluish-green color and saucer shape over Orlando Air Force Base on 31 Jan 1949.
interesting points: The object's size was described as being similar to an automobile wheel or a fist at arm's length.
Witnesses reported that the object had no sound, odor, trail, or projections, and appeared to be without substance.
Observers noted that the object appeared to be going on and off and at one point went behind another object before disappearing like a light switched off.
No air traffic was reported in the sky at the time of the sighting, and the weather conditions were clear with good visibility.
One observer, who was formerly an investigator with the Base Provost Marshall, was regarded as reliable by superiors and fellow MPs.
sighted object: unidentified aerial object with a bluish-green color and saucer shape
witnesses: Civilians & Airmen, including a Provost Sergeant and Enlisted Investigator
photographs: no photographs provided in the report
